snippet: Officials and groups called on the Board of Elections to reverse its decision to print candidates’ names on the ballots for next month’s elections in six-point font.
abstract: Elected officials and government watchdog groups criticize the New York City Board of Elections after it decides to print ballots for November elections with candidates’ names in miniature, six-point font.
lead_paragraph: Officials and groups called on the Board of Elections to reverse its decision to print candidates’ names on the ballots for next month’s elections in six-point font.

headline.main: New York City Ballots’ Tiny Print Is Criticized
